text: Your Mogis deck, probably?

Oppression is a really good card . . . but it's also a card that in any kind of set meta with people who know you and your deck you just create "oh, you're playing the deck running Oppression, let's all just kill you as fast as possible every single game".
The kind of deck I would run it in wouldn’t be making any friends anyhow. :smiling_imp:
i.e. most Mogis decks
I've considered Hecatomb a few times in my Teysa deck
Sacrificing a Reassembling Skeleton, Brood of Cockroaches, Bloodghast and Nether Spirit to cast it and make some spirits at the same time seems reasonable
I'd rather just run Pestilence though I think
It’s an interesting effect in mono-Black to weaponize your lands.
And it's one-sided unlike Pestilence
you just have to weigh how often your drawing a dead card. 4 creatures in edh is either really easy to have or practically never going to happen.
You basically need to be playing a token/recursion deck to take advantage

text: The problem with Razaketh's Rite is that cycling works best on cards you may not want to cost. The amount of situations you're gonna not want to cast a tutor seems pretty slim. I'd probably run Dark Petition there.

text: I tried it and found that the number of things you need to sacrifice is far too high in commander. They will take the life lose until around 10-15 life. But then you still had to eat through their cards in hand. On top of all that, it only hit one player. That left me and one other player with next to nothing and two players will a board full of stuff
Too bad it’s sorcery speed. I always like to find off-color sacrifice effects in black.
its great with [[second sunrise]] btw

I've got a brew I'm working on. It's part of my mono color restriction series, where I build decks off a difficult rule for each color. So far, I've done mono-green spells (all cards are green and none of them are creatures), mono-blue creatures (literally 62 creatures), and mono-black rare/mythic-less. My next is Mono-Red defender + sundial of the infinite shenanigans, since not attacking and extra turns are not red's thing. I just want to know if I am missing something. <https://www.mtggoldfish.com/deck/787686#paper>
